name: Supreme: Pizza Empire
description: Supreme allows you to pursue your wildest dream ever, the dream that you’ve wanted to fulfill all your life. Your dream of owning and operating your own Pizzeria franchise that you will dominate the world with...err… we mean make everyone full and happy with? Yeah that.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP3 Processor: 2.0 GHz Dual Core Processor Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: Integrated (512MB) DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 500 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 / Windows 8.1 Processor: 3.00GHz Dual Core or equivalent Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GT 610 DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: While this game has it's entertaining moments, it is not worth $13.99 in my opinion until they add some more features. The gist of the game is throwing on toppings, and driving through a small town in a car that's hard to control. Also, I hit a glitch after flipping my car, where my shop consistently lost $-7 a second, and made me up to -$15,000 in debt until I rage quit.

started from the bottom now we here  It's a game about pizza, that's all that matters.  You start off as some noob rolling dough in a dungeon, driving a POS to deliver to customers.  You grow to being a rich CEO with managers running your shops.

I fun game. Have to make orders right. The driving is fun. This kinda remind me of themepark type of game from childhood. Very happy are that :) The Dev team seems to do updates frequently, you can tell they care about there product.
Was actually more fun to play when it was in the most beginning stage of production.
VERY good game.  I bought this expecting it to be a simple casual game but actually it's very addicting. Managing pizza orders has never been so fun before.

There can always be complaints on a game. I have found myself playing this one like crazy. I am so glad I got it on the day it came out. The driving took a little to get used to but I mustard through it and now I am a driving champ. Although the direction arrow is still a little misleading I am getting the hang of it. The game did spaz out on me recently, kind of why I am taking a break. It just started deduction cash like crazy. Kind of funny I was over 2 million in debt, but the game kept playing anyway while it kept deducting like crazy. Over all I will have to give this a above average seeing how I love pizza and business. The 2 make a great match.

Despite the cover art, there is much more to this game with tons of laughs and of course seriousness. I enjoyed the task later on of trying NOT to flip my car and of course trying to keep up my money. Even though in the end.... I ended up bankrupt, but I got pretty far. For once I am enjoying a game that is PG and appropriate for the workplace and around other children (which most of my older friends would enjoy since they have children). I would definitely enjoy playing this game as a get away from the typical games that are popular right now. Plus... my favorite part about this game has to be the cheesy events. :P Ahem... Mind Control.
This game is increbily fun. If you don't buy this you will regret it for the rest of your life. No pressure

When first playing the game, I loved the music, exicted to make my own shop :D I laughed so hard when seeing my guy character for the first time xD The graphics look so cute and very nice, I love the clouds o-o; I love how much detail you guys put into the game, you didn't cut back on anything, it might not be high graphics but its still good enough to be able to play :) The pizza and toppings, to the car and being able to drive to my customer, so awesome! I would like to see others try it out, this game is fun to just play around on and see how far you can get, so much to do and with your spare time be able to play this and not get bored ^~^b
